sources.data_found: Pod GPU expansion: 12 -> 52 GPUs; includes 12 compute nodes each with 4x NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs; 10 nodes added to existing Pod (3 GPU nodes already).
Pod GPU nodes: Node[111-113,116-125] are GPU nodes; 4 NVIDIA V100 per node (NVLink).
Braid2 GPU inventory totals: 18x K80; 8x A40/24GB; 24x A100/40GB; 4x A100/80GB. Also states pod-gpu dev node has a V100 + a T4.
Knot GPU access via knot-gpu2: Titan V + GTX 1080 Ti + P100; 'There are no longer any other GPUs on knot.'
GRIT systems with GPUs: hpc-01 has A30 (1); hpc-02 has L40S (4).

student_data.notes:
UCSB College of Engineering 'Undergraduate Studies' page contains an 'ENROLLMENT AND DEGREES HISTORY' section with a 'Five-Year Enrollment History' table listing 'Computer Science' enrollment as 739 for Fall 2024.

I could not find an official source that explicitly breaks UCSB Computer Science graduate enrollment into MS-only vs PhD-only for Fall 2024 / AY 2024-25. The COE 2024 graduate programs PDF includes a Computer Science one-sheet stating '210 MS and PhD Students (Fall 2024)' but does not provide separate MS vs PhD counts, so grad_cs_count and phd_cs_count are set to 0.

Additional source (combined grad count only, no MS/PhD split): https://engineering.ucsb.edu/sites/default/files/docs/2024_UCSB_College_of_Engineering_GRAD_PROGRAMS.pdf

gpu_resources.notes:
Cluster-by-cluster breakdown (nodes × GPUs_per_node = total):
- CSC Pod (compute GPU nodes): Node[111-113,116-125] => (3 + 10) = 13 nodes; 13 × 4 V100 = 52 V100.
- CSC pod-gpu development node: 1 node × 1 V100 = 1 V100 (also has 1x T4, not counted in requested fields).
- CSC Braid2 (GPU totals given; nodes not explicitly listed, so nodes inferred using common 4-GPU nodes where it divides evenly):
  * A40: assume 2 nodes × 4 A40 = 8 A40.
  * A100 40GB: assume 6 nodes × 4 A100(40GB) = 24 A100(40GB).
  * A100 80GB: assume 1 node × 4 A100(80GB) = 4 A100(80GB).
  * K80: total is 18 K80 GPUs (not represented in output schema); to provide a nodes×gpus/node calculation, assumed 9 nodes × 2 K80 = 18 (assumption flagged; actual per-node layout not found).
- CSC Knot: knot-gpu2 is treated as 1 node × 1 P100 = 1 P100 (also has Titan V and GTX 1080 Ti).
- GRIT hpc-01: 1 node × 1 A30 = 1 A30 (not in output schema, placed in other_high_vram_gpus).
- GRIT hpc-02: 1 node × 4 L40S = 4 L40S.

Summed totals used for JSON fields:
- V100 = 52 (Pod compute nodes) + 1 (pod-gpu dev node) = 53.
- A100 40GB = 24.
- A100 80GB = 4.
- A40 = 8.
- P100 = 1.
- L40S = 4.
No UCSB sources found indicating any H100/H200/GH200/B100/B200 GPUs in these UCSB-managed resources.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
validation_notes: No changes made. All GPUs appear to be locally owned. Student data left as is, reflecting the source data.
